head.title: April 5-11; Race and the Death Sentence

hedline.hl1: April 5-11; Race and the Death Sentence

block.p: Is America's death penalty racist? A body of evidence suggests that it is: cases in which the crime is the same but punishment differs. A special United Nations investigator has issued a report asserting that skin color is a ''key determinant'' in consigning prisoners to death row. The report urged the United States to halt all executions until it can show that this ultimate punishment is doled out fairly. The racism is at its worst, the report said, in the deep South.
